meanings.definition: The act of cleaning up a place or area.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the cleanups were necessary to tidy up the mess.
meanings.sent2: The community organized cleanups to keep the park free of litter.
meanings.sent3: The cleanups after the picnic turned into a fun game of who could collect the most trash.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous cleanups transformed the cluttered room into a spotless sanctuary.
meanings.sent5: The cleanups in the kitchen made it sparkle like a diamond in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The process of removing dirt or impurities.
meanings.sent1: Proper cleanups ensure that all germs and bacteria are eliminated.
meanings.sent2: Regular cleanups of the water supply are crucial for maintaining public health.
meanings.sent3: The cleanups of the contaminated soil required special equipment and expertise.
meanings.sent4: The thorough cleanups of the factory machinery improved its efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The cleanups of the polluted river helped restore its natural beauty.

meanings.definition: An organized effort to make a place neat and tidy.
meanings.sent1: The neighborhood association planned cleanups to beautify the streets.
meanings.sent2: Volunteers joined hands for the annual beach cleanups to protect marine life.
meanings.sent3: The cleanups of the school playground involved students, teachers, and parents working together.
meanings.sent4: The city council initiated cleanups to revitalize the downtown area.
meanings.sent5: The cleanups of the public garden brought the community closer together.
